channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 Voi e scooters on pavement, 20th August
item.description:
There are 2 e-scooters on the pavement outside no. 36 Noverton Lane. One of them was reported directly to Voi on Monday morning but has not been removed. They seem to get moved quicker by reporting via fix my street. They continue to be left quite frequently in the same area of Noverton.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Noverton Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large mirror to be put on cycle path at corner as blind spot, 20th August
item.description:
Blind spot on cycle path. A number of near misses with cyclists etc Even with going really slowly I believe a large mirror is needed so everyone can see at this corner Blind spot
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Liddington Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Under the by-pass on left hand side going towards Cheltenham rd - from Cheltenham rd East, 20th August
item.description:
Lots of litter on cycle path. Can’t see properly as very dark underneath by- pass Keep seeing 2 men under there Have reported before, as they leave lots of litter on cycle path Dangerous as have to be carful not to go over the bottles etc
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Litter in street or public area

item.title: Vehicle abandoned for several months, 20th August
item.description:
This car has not moved for several months. I believe it to have been parked without moving since the end of may / beginning of June. I've not seen anyone interact with the car in that time. This is causing an obstruction for other neighbours who rely on that stretch of road to park thier vehicles. Recognise it's a public road so it's allowed but it seems unfair to leave abandoned outside my house for so long now

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Billbrook Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway is worn down in several places, 20th August
item.description:
The pathway is worn down in several places. It is a busy route to school and is becoming more challenging with pushchairs and small wheels.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Glynrosa Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Street light number 12 is not working, 20th August
item.description:
On Kidnappers Lane, Cheltenham, street light number 12 is not working. This was broken last year but you managed to get the developer responsible to fix it (it is on a public thoroughfare, NOT a development or housing association site). However, it is not working again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tipping of waste garden cuttings and branches, 19th August
item.description:
Wellington Lane outside Rosehill House and behind Anlaby Court garages. I can not get my car out of my garage due this obstructing the road. It is also blowing around now and some of it is in the road and in front of my garage. Please can this be removed as last time this happened it was followed by more as people just see it as a dumping place. It has been there for over two weeks now and the more it dries out the more is blowing around. There are rats there as well and I don’t want them nesting outside my gate where my dog might get bitten.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potentially dangerous tree, 19th August
item.description:
At the junction between Hatherley Lane and Wade Court there is a small wooded area with mature trees. One of those trees has today had a large branch split off and fall into my garden. The tree itself seems very unsteady, and I am worried that it might be in danger of falling. It also touches the side of my house
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
